content:
I am an Assistant Professor of Economics in the Department of Economics at the Shippensburg University of Pennsylvania. My research includes topics within health, energy, and public/regional economics.
I am teaching Managerial Economics in summer 2021 and fall 2021 and Regional Economics in spring 2022. In addition, I have taught Economic Analysis of Big Data, Principles of Economics, Principles of Macroeconomics, Business Data Visualization, and Elementary Business & Economic Statistics.
For any questions about my research or other scholarly activities, please contact me by email. You can also reach me on Twitter @econshishir.
Highlights:
 Jun 2021: Paper with Kazi Sohag titled “The Fracking Boom and Crime Rates in Rural American States: Some Critical Insights” is published in The Extractive Industries and Society.
 Feb 2021: Scott Cunningham author of the book Causal Inference: The Mixtape asked what my thoughts were on various online casual inference courses on the different platforms (for free) that I took. I made a Twitter thread; see here. Many researchers, students, and causal inference enthusiasts loved it.
 Jan 2021: Paper with Alicia Plemmons titled The Impact of Economic Freedom on Startups is published in the Journal of Regional Analysis & Policy. Bridwell Institute for Economic Freedom shared our paper on their Twitter @SMUCoxBridwell.
 2020: Prescription Drug Abuse Policy System- PDAPS.org put my working paper County-Level Assessment of Prescription Drug Monitoring Program and Opioid Prescription Rate in their resources. http://pdaps.org/resources.
 2020: Scope of practice laws and the mobility of nurse practitioners is published in the Journal of Labor Research. Highlights are on Twitter. CSOR St. Francis University, The Knee Center for the Study of Occupational Regulation at Saint Francis mentions this paper on LinkedIn.
 2020: Paper with Elham Erfanian and Alexandre Scarcioffolo titled The political economy of Vermont’s abortion bill is published in Applied Economics Letters.
